name: Vincent van Gogh
description: Vincent Willem van Gogh was a Dutch post-impressionist painter who is among the most famous and influential figures in the history of Western art. In just over a decade, he created about 2,100 artworks, including around 860 oil paintings, most of which date from the last two years of his life.

name: Maxence
description: Maxence is a fictional character played by Jérémie Covillault in the TV series "La Révolution". In the show, he's a priest close to Joseph Guillotin and he believes that everyone deserves to be saved.

name: Mahatma Gandhi
description: Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi was an Indian lawyer, anti-colonial nationalist, and political ethicist, who employed nonviolent resistance to lead the successful campaign for India's independence from British Rule, and in turn inspire movements for civil rights and freedom across the world.

name: Vasily Borgov
description: Vasily Borgov is a fictional character played by Marcin Dorociński in the TV miniseries The Queen's Gambit. In the show, he's the current Soviet-Russian world champion chess player and Beth's strongest competitor.

name: Esty
description: Esther "Esty" Shapiro is a fictional character played by Shira Haas in the miniseries "Unorthodox". In the miniseries, she's a 19-year-old Jewish woman who runs away from her arranged marriage and Ultra-Orthodox community in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, New York City. She moves to Berlin, where her estranged mother lives, and tries to navigate a secular life and take classes at a music conservatory.

name: Joseph Ignace Guillotin
description: Joseph Ignace Guillotin is a fictional character played by Amir El Kacem in the TV series "La Révolution". In the shows, he's a physician (medical doctor) investigating mysterious deaths and disparitions. Although fictional, this character truly existed between 28 May 1738 – 26 March 1814.

name: Dan Broderick
description: Dan Broderick is a fictional character played by Christian Slater in the TV series "Dirty Jonh". In the show, he's a lawyer specialized in pursuing medical malpactrices. He's married to Betty and has four children.

name: Claude Bolton
description: Claude Bolton is a fictional character played by Paddy Considine in the TV miniseries The Outsider. He's a bouncer at the Peach Crease night club.

name: Herbert Zucker
description: Herbert Zucker is a fictional character played by Steve Witting in the TV miniseries The Outsider. He is a psychologist who has the detective Ralph as a patient.

name: Billy Alsbrooks
description: Billy Alsbrooks, Jr., better known by his stage name White Dawg, is an American rapper and record producer.

name: Mary Whitney
description: Mary Whitney is a fictional character, a maid, and friend of Grace Marks. Mary believes in herself and in Canada as a place that a hard working girl can earn her way. She plans to save her wages for a dowry so she can marry a farmer and be mistress of her own home. She's played by  Rebecca Liddiard in the miniserie.

name: Roger Staubach
description: Roger Thomas Staubach, nicknamed "Roger the Dodger", "Captain America" and "Captain Comeback", is an American former professional football player who was a quarterback for the Dallas Cowboys in the National Football League.

name: Travis
description: Travis is a widower whose daughter goes to the same school as Marah and finds a connection with Kate

name: Arthur Ashe
description: Arthur Robert Ashe Jr. was an American professional tennis player who won three Grand Slam titles. Ashe was the first black player selected to the United States Davis Cup team and the only black man ever to win the singles title at Wimbledon, the US Open, and the Australian Open. He retired in 1980.

name: Jesus
description: Jesus, also referred to as Jesus of Nazareth or Jesus Christ, was a first-century Jewish preacher and religious leader. He is the central figure of Christianity. Most Christians believe he is the incarnation of God the Son and the awaited Messiah (the Christ) prophesied in the Old Testament.

name: Reynolds Woodcock
description: Reynolds Woodcock is a fictional character played by Daniel Day-Lewis in the film Phantom Thread. In the film, he creates dresses for members of high society, even royalty. His clients view him as a genius whose creations enable them to become their best selves; but his creativity and charm are matched by his obsessive and controlling personality.

name: St. Jean-Baptiste-Marie Vianney
description: Jean-Baptiste-Marie Vianney, T.O.S.F., commonly known in English as Saint John Vianney, was a French parish priest who is venerated in the Catholic Church as a saint and as the patron saint of parish priests.

name: Cédric Ingrand
description: Cédric Ingrand is a french journalist working in the field of Internet and technologies. He hosts "Plein Écran" on the french channel LCI.  he also takes part in various prpgrams such as "Les coulisses de l'économie" on TF1, "Le Rendez-vous Tech" or "On Refait le Mac".

name: Jonathan Kozol
description: Jonathan Kozol is an American writer, educator, and activist, best known for his books on public education in the United States.

name: Leonardo da Vinci
description: Leonardo di ser Piero da Vinci, known as Leonardo da Vinci, was an Italian polymath of the Renaissance whose areas of interest included invention, drawing, painting, sculpture, architecture, science, music, mathematics, engineering, literature, anatomy, geology, astronomy, botany, paleontology, and cartography.

name: Norman Vincent Peale
description: Norman Vincent Peale was an American minister and author known for his work in popularizing the concept of positive thinking, especially through his best-selling book The Power of Positive Thinking.

name: Nina's grandfather
description: Nina's grandfather comes to Japan with his granddaughter, as she has her pianist concert.

name: Adam (old)
description: Adam is a fictional character played by Dietrich Hollinderbäumer in the TV series "Dark". This character refers to an old and disfigured Adam. He's also the leader of Sic Mundus.

name: Norman Vaughan
description: Norman Edward Vaughan was an English comedian who led a long and successful career in the television and theatre, appearing occasionally in films.

name: Ralph Waldo Emerson
description: Ralph Waldo Emerson was an American essayist, lecturer, philosopher, and poet who led the transcendentalist movement of the mid-19th century.

name: Charles Swindoll
description: Charles Rozell "Chuck" Swindoll is an evangelical Christian pastor, author, educator, and radio preacher. He founded Insight for Living, headquartered in Frisco, Texas, which airs a radio program of the same name on more than 2,000 stations around the world in 15 languages.

name: Gloria Steinem
description: Gloria Marie Steinem is an American feminist, journalist, and social political activist who became nationally recognized as a leader and a spokeswoman for the American feminist movement in the late 1960s and early 1970s. Steinem was a columnist for New York magazine, and a co-founder of Ms. magazine.

name: Thomas Howard, Duke of Norfolk
description: Thomas Howard, 3rd Duke of Norfolk KG PC, was a prominent English politician and nobleman of the Tudor era. He was an uncle of two of the wives of King Henry VIII, namely Anne Boleyn and Catherine Howard, both of whom were beheaded, and played a major role in the machinations affecting these royal marriages. In the film "The Other Boleyn Girl" he is played by David Morrissey.

name: Charles Kuralt
description: Charles Bishop Kuralt was an American journalist. He is most widely known for his long career with CBS, first for his "On the Road" segments on The CBS Evening News with Walter Cronkite, and later as the first anchor of CBS News Sunday Morning, a position he held for fifteen years.

name: Dave Amari
description: Dave Amari is a fictional character played by Ennis Esmer in the TV series "You Me Her". In the show, he's one of the Trakarsky's neighbors and Jack's best friend.

name: Edgar Allan Poe
description: Edgar Allan Poe was an American writer, poet, editor, and literary critic. Poe is best known for his poetry and short stories, particularly his tales of mystery and the macabre.

name: Shigeru Miyamoto
description: Shigeru Miyamoto is a Japanese video game designer and producer at Nintendo, where he serves as one of its representative directors. He is the creator of some of the most acclaimed and best-selling game franchises of all time, such as Mario and The Legend of Zelda.

name: Abraham Lincoln
description: Abraham Lincoln was an American statesman and lawyer who served as the 16th president of the United States from March 1861 until his assassination in April 1865. Lincoln led the nation through the American Civil War, its bloodiest war and its greatest moral, constitutional, and political crisis.

name: Forest officer 1
description: This forest guard was doing a night walk on his horse but encounters Marianne. He appears on season 1 chapter 6, around the time code: 14:00.

name: Sigmund Freud
description: Sigmund Freud was an Austrian neurologist and the founder of psychoanalysis, a clinical method for treating psychopathology through dialogue between a patient and a psychoanalyst. Freud was born to Galician Jewish parents in the Moravian town of Freiberg, in the Austrian Empire.

name: Etoiles
description: Étoiles is a french Twitch streamer. He's mostly known for his culture streams and his high skills in video games, notably on Super Smash Bros. He regularly co-host "The Night of Culture" with Samuel Etienne, the television host of "Questions pour un champion".

name: Farrah Gray
description: Farrah Gray is an American businessman, investor, author, columnist, and motivational speaker. Gray was raised on Chicago's South side. He began his entrepreneurial career at the age of six selling homemade lotion and hand-painted rocks door-to-door.

name: George Addair
description: George Washington Adair was a real-estate developer in post Civil War Atlanta.

name: Charles de Montargis
description: Charles de Montargis is a fictional character played by Laurent Lucas in the TV series "La Révolution". In the show he's Elise's uncle and Donatien father. He has a manipulator mind and doesn't have a high esteem of other  people.

name: Virginia Woolf
description: Adeline Virginia Woolf was an English writer, considered one of the most important modernist 20th-century authors and also a pioneer in the use of stream of consciousness as a narrative device. Woolf was born into an affluent household in South Kensington, London, the seventh child in a blended family of eight.

name: Mary Morrison
description: Mary Morrison is a successful author of thriller novels in the film "Deadly illusions". The character is played by Kristin Davis.

name: V
description: V is a mercenary and the main character in the video game Cyberpunk 2077.

name: Nick Carraway
description: Nick Carraway is a fictional character and narrator in F. Scott Fitzgerald's The Great Gatsby (1925).  In the 2013 film, he is  a would-be writer, Gatsby's friend, and the film's narrator.

name: Ava Silva
description: Ava Silva is a fictionnal character played by Alba Baptista in the TV series Warrior Nun.

name: Viktor E. Frankl
description: Viktor Emil Frankl was an Austrian neurologist and psychiatrist as well as a Holocaust survivor, surviving Theresienstadt, Kaufering and Türkheim.

name: Ben Wood
description: Ben Wood is a fictional character played by James Marsden in the TV series Dead to Me. He's Steve's semi-identical twin brother and Jen's new love interest who is a chiropractor.

name: Narrator
description: The narrator in the video game "Little Hope" tells part of the story to the player and help to understand what happened.

name: Bill Cosby
description: William Henry Cosby Jr. is an American stand-up comedian, actor, musician, author, and convicted sex offender. Cosby began his career as a stand-up comic at the hungry i in San Francisco during the 1960s.

name: Jim Preston
description: Jim Preston is a fictional character played by Chris Pratt in the film "Passengers". In the film, he's a mechanical engineer who wakes up 90 years too early on a sleeper ship transporting 5,000 colonists and 258 crew members in hibernation pods. The ship is travelling from Earth to the planet Homestead II.

name: Alfred, Lord Tennyson
description: Alfred Tennyson, 1st Baron Tennyson FRS was a British poet. He was the Poet Laureate during much of Queen Victoria's reign and remains one of the most popular British poets. In 1829, Tennyson was awarded the Chancellor's Gold Medal at Cambridge for one of his first pieces, "Timbuktu".

name: Nicoll Hunt
description: Creator of FIST OF AWESOME and co-creator of BREW TOWN & MAXIMUM CAR. More beard than man. He/him.

name: William of Ockham
description: English Franciscan friar, scholastic philosopher, and theologian, who is believed to have been born in Ockham, a small village in Surrey.

name: Maghla
description: Maghla is a french Twitch streamer. She plays various video games including adventure, FPS (First Person Shooter) or horror. Her streams contain also manual craft and cooking amoung other activites.

name: Y-Vonne Hutchinson
description: Former international human rights lawyer. Lover of planes, puppies, pie and Studs Terkel.

name: Zeus
description: Zeus is the sky and thunder god in ancient Greek religion, who rules as king of the gods of Mount Olympus. His name is cognate with the first element of his Roman equivalent Jupiter.

name: Boulet
description: Quality strip cartoon for whole family since 2001. Director of collection (#Octopus éditions Delcourt).

name: Steve Jobs
description: DescriptionSteven Paul Jobs was an American business magnate, industrial designer, investor, and media proprietor.

name: Baron de Lariboise
description: Le Baron de Lariboise is a fictional character played by Pierre ANDRAU in the TV series "La Révolution". He's a noble who's friend with Elise de Montargis and doesn't really like Donatien de Montargis.

name: Ryo Saeba
description:
Ryo Saeba (冴羽獠, Saeba Ryo) is a sweeper in Tokyo and the main character of the City Hunter series.

At the age of three, Ryo was the only survivor of a plane crash in Central America. He was raised as a guerilla fighter and has no knowledge of his prior identity. After the war, Ryo makes his way to the United States, before eventually moving to Tokyo.

name: Edouard Philippe
description: Édouard Charles Philippe is a French politician serving as Prime Minister of France since 15 May 2017 under President Emmanuel Macron. A lawyer by occupation, Philippe is a former member of the Union for a Popular Movement, which later became The Republicans.

name: Dr. Pasquier
description: Dr. Pasquier is a psychiatrist helping Pauline in her life and psyhcological issues.

name: Father Vincent
description: Father Vincent is a fictional character played by Tristán Ulloa in the TV series Warrior Nun.

name: Horizon-Gull
description: Official YouTube channel of Hacking social blog.

name: Kristian Schaefer
description: Kristian Schaefer is a fictional character played by Peter de Jersey in the TV series Warrior Nun.

name: Serap
description: Serap is a fictional character played by Başak Köklükaya in the TV series "Atiye (The Gift)". In the show, she's Atiye's mother and has a strange history with her own mother.

name: Richard Branson
description: Sir Richard Charles Nicholas Branson is a British business magnate, investor, author and philanthropist. He founded the Virgin Group in the 1970s, which controls more than 400 companies in various fields. Branson expressed his desire to become an entrepreneur at a young age.

name: Anaïs Nin
description: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell, known professionally as Anaïs Nin was a French-Cuban American diarist, essayist, novelist, and writer of short stories and erotica. Born to Cuban parents in France, Nin was the daughter of composer Joaquín Nin and Rosa Culmell, a classically trained singer.

name: Chiron
description: In Greek mythology, Chiron was held to be the superlative centaur amongst his brethren since he was called the "wisest and justest of all the centaurs".

name: Hannah Grose
description: Hannah Grose is a fictional character played by  T'Nia Miller in the TV series "The Haunting of Bly Manor". In the show, she's the housekeeper. She has a good relationship with the house's occupants.

name: Bill Tench
description:
Bill Tench, a special agent in the FBI's Behavio
ral Science Unit, is a fictional character in Mindhunter TV series.

name: Isaac
description: Isaac is a rivalrous devil forgemaster and fierce loyalist of Dracula who helps to lead his army.

name: J.P. Morgan
description: John Pierpont Morgan Sr. was an American financier and banker who dominated corporate finance on Wall Street throughout the Gilded Age.

name: Chad Wiley
description: Chad Wiley is a fictional character played by Patrick Sabongui in the streaming TV series "Firefly Lane". In the show, he's a college professor teaching journalism classes, and has Tully as a student.

name: Cyrus Albright
description: Cyrus Albright is one of eight playable characters in Octopath Traveler. He is a professor at the Royal Academy located in Atlasdam, found in the Flatlands. Cyrus is known for caring greatly about knowledge and his passion for teaching.

name: Harry Beltik
description: Harry Beltik is a fictional character played by Harry Melling in the TV series The Queen's Gambit. In the show, he's a champion player Beth defeats in her first tournament and later befriends.

name: Jen Harding
description: Jen Harding, is a fictional character played by Christina Applegate in the TV series Dead to Me. In the series, she's a realtor whose husband Ted was killed by a hit-and-run driver.

name: Ben Frémont
description: Ben Frémont is a fictional character in the french novel "Le parfum du bonheur est plus fort sous la pluie" in which he's Pauline's husband. They've a four years old children and try to navigate their relation's difficulties.

name: Socrates
description: Socrates was a classical Greek philosopher credited as one of the founders of Western philosophy, and as being the first moral philosopher of the Western ethical tradition of thought.

name: Det. Ralph Anderson
description: Detective Ralph Anderson is a fictional character played by Ben Mendelsohn in the TV miniseries The Outsider.

name: George Eliot
description: Mary Ann Evans, known by her pen name George Eliot, was an English novelist, poet, journalist, translator and one of the leading writers of the Victorian era.

name: Lenore
description: Lenore is the diplomat member of the Council of Sisters. She is in charge of subduing Hector.

name: Gandhi
description: Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi was an Indian lawyer, anti-colonial nationalist, and political ethicist, who employed nonviolent resistance to lead the successful campaign for India's independence from British Rule, and in turn inspire movements for civil rights and freedom across the world.

name: Zig Ziglar
description: Hilary Hinton "Zig" Ziglar was an American author, salesman, and motivational speaker.

name: Avis Amberg (fictional)
description: Avis Amberg is a fictional character played by Patti LuPone in the TV miniseries "Hollywood". She plays the wife of Ace Amberg, the head of Ace Studios, and a former actress.

name: Jim Kwik
description: He is the CEO and Founder of Kwik Learning, a leader in accelerated learning with online students of every age and vocation in over 150 countries.

name: Iris Simpkins
description: Iris Simpkins is a fictional character issued by Kate Winslet in the film "The Holiday".

name: Dale Carnegie
description: Dale Breckenridge Carnegie was an American writer and lecturer, and the developer of famous courses in self-improvement, salesmanship, corporate training, public speaking, and interpersonal skills.

name: Oscar Wilde
description: Oscar Fingal O'Flahertie Wills Wilde was an Irish poet and playwright. After writing in different forms throughout the 1880s, the early 1890s saw him become one of the most popular playwrights in London.

name: George Bernard Shaw
description: George Bernard Shaw, known at his insistence simply as Bernard Shaw, was an Irish playwright, critic, polemicist and political activist. His influence on Western theatre, culture and politics extended from the 1880s to his death and beyond.

name: Lao Tzu
description: Laozi, also rendered as Lao Tzu and Lao-Tze, was an ancient Chinese philosopher and writer. He is the reputed author of the Tao Te Ching, the founder of philosophical Taoism, and a deity in religious Taoism and traditional Chinese religions.

name: Beverly Sills
description: Beverly Sills was an American operatic soprano whose peak career was between the 1950s and 1970s. Although she sang a repertoire from Handel and Mozart to Puccini, Massenet and Verdi, she was known for her performances in coloratura soprano roles in live opera and recordings.

name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
description: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe was a German writer and statesman. His works include: four novels; epic and lyric poetry; prose and verse dramas; memoirs; an autobiography; literary and aesthetic criticism; and treatises on botany, anatomy, and colour.

name: Kalindi
job: Rédac & chef de projet cinéma et séries télé
description: Rédac & chef de projet cinéma et séries télé pour le magazine MademoiZelle.

name: Alice Walker
description: Alice Walker is an American novelist, short story writer, poet, and social activist. In 1982, she wrote the novel The Color Purple, for which she won the National Book Award for hardcover fiction, and the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction. She also wrote the novels Meridian and The Third Life of Grange Copeland.

name: Sofia Seranno
description: Sofia Serrano is a fictional character played by Penélope Cruz in the film Vanilla Sky. She's a dancer who meets David Aames at a party in Manhattan thanks to a friend. They spend the night together in Sofia's apartment.

name: Katell
description: Katell is a fictional character played by Isabel Aimé González-Sola in the TV series "La Révolution". In the show, she works in the prison brigging goods to the convicts and starts a relation with Joseph Guillotin.

name: Erica Jong
description: Erica Jong is an American novelist, satirist, and poet, known particularly for her 1973 novel Fear of Flying. The book became famously controversial for its attitudes towards female sexuality and figured prominently in the development of second-wave feminism.

name: Arnaud (Stupid Economics)
description: Arnaud (Stupid Economics) is a french YouTuber talking about economy. He's the main host on the YouTube channel "Stupid Economics" and does live streams on Twitch from time to time.

name: Sister Mary
description: Sister Mary alias Shotgun Mary is a fictional character played by Toya Turner in the TV series Warrior Nun.

name: Tai Lopez
description: Tai Lopez is an investor, partner, or advisor to over 20 multi-million dollar businesses. Through his popular book club and podcasts Tai shares advice on how to achieve health, wealth, love, and happiness with 1.4 million people in 40 countries.

name: Samuel Beckett
description: Samuel Barclay Beckett was an Irish novelist, playwright, short story writer, theatre director, poet, and literary translator. A resident of Paris for most of his adult life, he wrote in both French and English.

name: The Cowboy
description: He gives advices and warnings to Justin Theroux after he quits his job. The Cowboy is a fictional character played by the actor Monty Montgomery.

name: Etienne de La Boétie
description: Étienne or Estienne de La Boétie was a French judge, writer and "a founder of modern political philosophy in France". He is best remembered as the great and close friend of the eminent essayist Michel de Montaigne "in one of history's most notable friendships", as well as an earlier influence for anarchist thought.

name: Sir Claus Moser
description: Claus Adolf Moser, Baron Moser, KCB, CBE was a British statistician who made major contributions in both academia and the Civil Service.

name: Jérôme Keinborg
description: Video producer @nowtechtv. French but US childhood. Web video Consultant production.

name: Talluha "Tully" Hart
description: Talluha "Tully" Hart, is a fictional character played by Katherine Heigl in the streaming TV series "Firefly Lane". In the show, she's a famous host of a daytime talk show known as The Girlfriend Hour.

name: Robert J. Hanlon
description: Robert J. Hanlon is an author.

name: Paula Poundstone
description: Paula Poundstone is an American stand-up comedian, author, actress, interviewer, and commentator. Beginning in the late 1980s, she performed a series of one-hour HBO comedy specials. She provided backstage commentary during the 1992 presidential election on The Tonight Show with Jay Leno.

name: Christophe Castaner
job: Minister of the Interior of France
description: Christophe Castaner is a French politician who has been serving as the Minister of the Interior since 16 October 2018 and as the Executive Officer of La République En Marche! since 2017.

name: Oka
description: Okka is a fictional character played by Doudou Masta in the TV series "La Révolution". In the show, he's a prisoner and reveals some information to Joseph Guillotin.

name: Albert Einstein
description: Albert Einstein was a German-born theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity, one of the two pillars of modern physics. His work is also known for its influence on the philosophy of science.

name: Stephen R. Covey
description: Stephen Richards Covey was an American educator, author, businessman, and keynote speaker. His most popular book is The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People.

name: Steven Pressfield
description: Steven Pressfield is an American author of historical fiction, non-fiction, and screenplays.

name: Graham
description: Graham Simpkins is a fictional character played by Jude Law in the film "The Holiday".

name: Woody Allen
description: Heywood "Woody" Allen is an American director, writer, actor, and comedian whose career spans more than six decades. He began his career as a comedy writer in the 1950s, writing jokes and scripts for television and publishing several books of short humor pieces.

name: Hilda Spellman
description: Hildegarde Antoinette "Hilda" Spellman is a character featured in the Archie comic book Sabrina the Teenage Witch. In the Netflix TV series, she's played by Lucy Davis. Hilda is a full witch (as opposed to half or fully mortal) who lives in the fictional town of Greendale (in the 1990s live-action sitcom, Hilda lives in fictional Westbridge, Massachusetts). Hilda lives with her niece Sabrina Spellman, sister Zelda Spellman, and the family cat Salem, a former witch turned into a cat as punishment for his attempt at world domination.

name: Lola Guilldou
description: Lola is a french game designer, graphic designer, content creator on YouTube and Twitch. She's the author of the game Puppy Cross, a pycross game with dogs. She also gives talks at conferences.

name: Jacques-Bénigne Bossuet
description: Jacques-Bénigne Lignel Bossuet was a French bishop and theologian, renowned for his sermons and other addresses. He has been considered by many to be one of the most brilliant orators of all time and a masterly French stylist.

name: Ponce
description: Ponce, also known as the flowers king, is a french Twitch streamer. He plays various video games like Mario Kart, Zelda or Outer Wilds. On mondays, he organizes culture games with his viewers.

name: Sypha Belnades
description: Sypha Belnades is a Speaker Magician and the Elder's granddaughter who wields powerful elemental magic. She travels with Trevor Belmont.

name: Jada Pinkett Smith
description: Jada Koren Pinkett Smith is an American actress, screenwriter, producer, talk show host, businesswoman, and an occasional singer-songwriter. She began her acting career in 1990, with a guest appearance on the short-lived sitcom True Colors, and subsequently starred in the television series A Different World.

name: Rolf Potts
description: Rolf Potts is an American travel writer, essayist, podcaster, and author. He has written four books, including Vagabonding, Marco Polo Didn't Go There, and Souvenir. His travel writing has appeared in National Geographic Traveler, Outside, Salon.com, Slate.com, The Guardian, and World Hum.

name: Jacques Henriot
description: Jacques Henriot is a french wirter and author of the book "Sous couleur de jouer". His book analyzes video games through psychology and the "gamification" concept.

name: Sheryl Sandberg
description: Sheryl Kara Sandberg is an American technology executive, author, and billionaire. She is the chief operating officer of Facebook and founder of LeanIn.Org. In June 2012, she was elected to Facebook's board of directors by existing board members, becoming the first woman to serve on its board.

name: Bob Dylan
description: Bob Dylan is an American singer-songwriter, author, and visual artist who has been a major figure in popular culture for more than fifty years.

name: Jean Massiet
description: Jean Massiet is a french political reporter who created Accropolis, a political news live stream. He worked with known politicians like Marisol Touraine, and at "La Ville de Paris". Youth and popular education activist, he wants to democratize politics to help people better understand the news. He's also passionate about video games and web culture.

name: Thomas J. Watson
description: Thomas John Watson Sr. was an American businessman. He served as the chairman and CEO of International Business Machines. He oversaw the company's growth into an international force from 1914 to 1956. Watson developed IBM's management style and corporate culture from John Henry Patterson's training at NCR.

name: Rue Bennett
description: Rue Bennett is a fictional character played by Zendaya in the TV series Euphoria. In the series, she's a recovering teenage drug addict struggling to find her place in the world.

name: Maurits Cornelis Escher
description: Maurits Cornelis Escher was a Dutch graphic artist who made mathematically inspired woodcuts, lithographs, and mezzotints. Despite wide popular interest, Escher was for long somewhat neglected in the art world, even in his native Netherlands. He was 70 before a retrospective exhibition was held.

name: Ian Bogost
description: Ian Bogost is an American academic and video game designer. He holds a joint professorship in the School of Literature, Media, and Communication and in Interactive Computing in the College of Computing at the Georgia Institute of Technology, where he is the Ivan Allen College of Liberal Arts Distinguished Chair in Media Studies.

name: Bob Marley
description: Robert Nesta Marley, OM was a Jamaican singer, songwriter, and musician. Considered one of the pioneers of reggae, his musical career was marked by fusing elements of reggae, ska, and rocksteady, as well as his distinctive vocal and songwriting style.

name: Angelica Green
description: Angelica Green is a fictional character in the Daybreak TV series, where she is a 10 year old genius with mild pyromania.

name: Patrick Bialès
description: Commissaire Patrick Bialès is a fictional character in the french movie "La Cité de la peur" played by Gérard Darmon.

name: Emma Green
description: Emma Green is a fictional character played by Hilary Swank in the TV series Away. In the show, she's a NASA astronaut who is commander of the mission and ship Atlas.

name: Father
description: David Thewlis is an English actor (among other jobs) playing Jake's father in the film "i'm thinking of ending things".

name: Douglas Adams
description: Douglas Noel Adams was an English author, screenwriter, essayist, humorist, satirist and dramatist. Adams was author of The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, which originated in 1978 as a BBC radio comedy before developing into a "trilogy" of five books that sold more than 15 million copies in his lifetime and generated a television series, several stage plays, comics, a video game, and in 2005 a feature film.

name: Christopher Nolan
description: Christopher Edward Nolan CBE is a British-American filmmaker known for making personal, distinctive films within the Hollywood mainstream. His directorial efforts have grossed more than US$5 billion worldwide, garnered 34 Oscar nominations and ten wins.

name: The Nerdwriter
description: The Nerdwriter is a weekly video essay series that puts ideas to work.

name: Rosa Parks
description: Rosa Louise McCauley Parks was an American activist in the civil rights movement best known for her pivotal role in the Montgomery bus boycott. The United States Congress has called her "the first lady of civil rights" and "the mother of the freedom movement".

name: Françoise Bertin
description: Françoise Bertin was a French actress. She appeared in over 125 films since 1961. Among these were five films directed by Alain Resnais: Last Year at Marienbad, Muriel, The War Is Over, I Want to Go Home, and Same Old Song. Born in Paris on 23 September 1925, she died in Galan, Hautes-Pyrénées, on 26 October 2014.

name: Anne Lamott
description: Anne Lamott is an American novelist and non-fiction writer. She is also a progressive political activist, public speaker, and writing teacher. Lamott is based in Marin County, California. Her nonfiction works are largely autobiographical.

name: Jake
description: Jake is a fictional character played by Jesse Plemons in the film "i'm thinking of ending things". He's Lucy's boyfriend and plan to go visit his parent on their farm.

name: Paul Theroux
description: Paul Edward Theroux is an American travel writer and novelist, whose best-known work is The Great Railway Bazaar. He has published numerous works of fiction, some of which were adapted as feature films.

name: Marie Adler
description: Marie Adler is a fictional character which is a victim of sexual assault in the American miniseries Unbelievable.

name: Zdzisław Beksiński
description: Zdzisław Beksiński was a Polish painter, photographer and sculptor, specializing in the field of dystopian surrealism. Beksiński made his paintings and drawings in what he called either a 'Baroque' or a 'Gothic' manner. His creations were made mainly in two periods.

name: Aristotle
description: Aristotle was a Greek philosopher and polymath during the Classical period in Ancient Greece. He was the founder of the Lyceum and the Peripatetic school of philosophy and Aristotelian tradition. Along with his teacher Plato, he has been called the "Father of Western Philosophy".

name: Marques Brownlee
description: Also known professionally as MKBHD, he is an American YouTuber, best known for his technology-focused videos.

name: Oprah Winfrey
description: Oprah Gail Winfrey is an American media executive, actress, talk show host, television producer, and philanthropist.

name: Christopher Columbus
description: Christopher Columbus was an Italian explorer and colonizer who completed four voyages across the Atlantic Ocean that opened the New World for conquest and permanent European colonization of the Americas.

name: Bill Parrish
description: Bill Parrish if a fictional character played by Anthony Hopkins in the film "Meet Joe Black".

name: La chaîne de P.A.U.L
description: La chaîne de P.A.U.L is a french YouTube channel making documentary about celebrities or fictional characters like the Joker, Emma Watson and Orelsan.

name: Émile Gravier
description: Émile Gravier is a fictional character from the french movie "La Cité de la peur", played by Sam Karmann.

name: Joseph Campbell
description: Joseph John Campbell was an American professor of literature at Sarah Lawrence College who worked in comparative mythology and comparative religion. His work covers many aspects of the human experience.

name: Michel de Montaigne
description: Michel Eyquem de Montaigne, Lord of Montaigne was one of the most significant philosophers of the French Renaissance, known for popularizing the essay as a literary genre. His work is noted for its merging of casual anecdotes and autobiography with intellectual insight.

name: Paul Fussel
description: Paul Fussell, Jr. was an American cultural and literary historian, author and university professor. His writings cover a variety of topics, from scholarly works on eighteenth-century English literature to commentary on America's class system.

name: Amanda Knox
description: Amanda Knox is an exoneree, journalist, public speaker, and author of the New York Times best-selling memoir, Waiting to Be Heard (HarperCollins, April 2013). Between 2007 and 2015, she spent nearly four years in an Italian prison and eight years on trial for a murder she didn’t commit. The controversy over Amanda’s case made international headlines for nearly a decade, and thrust her into the spotlight, where she was vilified and shamed. Amanda now works to shed light on the issues of wrongful conviction, truth seeking, and public shaming, and to inspire people towards empathy and perspective.

name: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
description: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow was an American poet and educator whose works include "Paul Revere's Ride", The Song of Hiawatha, and Evangeline. He was the first American to translate Dante Alighieri's Divine Comedy and was one of the Fireside Poets from New England.

name: Isabelle "Izzy" Silva
description: A graduate student in psychology and escort girl in the TV series You Me Her.

name: Jesper Juul
description: Jesper Juul is a Danish game designer, educator, and theorist in the field of video game studies. He is an associate professor at the Danish Design School. Juul is co-editor, with William Uricchio and Geoffrey Long, of the MIT Press Playful Thinking series.

name: Pablo Picasso
description: Pablo Ruiz Picasso was a Spanish painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet and playwright who spent most of his adult life in France.

name: Dr. Karl Landy
description: Dr. Karl Landy is Anna's psychiatrist in the film The Woman in the Window. He's played by Tracy Letts.

name: Clausen
description: Clausen is a fictional character played by Sylvester Groth in the TV series "Dark". He arrives in the second season as an investigator assisting Charlotte and the police force.

name: Dirty Biology
description: Science videos on mind fuck and fun subjects.

name: Kenneth Hayes
description: Kenneth Hayes is a fictional character played by Michael Esper in the TV miniseries The Outsider. He is a legal prosecutor.

name: Frank Sinatra
description: Francis Albert Sinatra was an American singer, actor and producer who was one of the most popular and influential musical artists of the 20th century. He is one of the best-selling music artists of all time, having sold more than 150 million records worldwide.

name: Peter Singer
description: Peter Albert David Singer AC is an Australian moral philosopher. He is the Ira W. DeCamp Professor of Bioethics at Princeton University, and a Laureate Professor at the Centre for Applied Philosophy and Public Ethics at the University of Melbourne.

name: Howard Salomon
description: Howard Salomon is a fictional character played by Bill Camp in the TV miniseries The Outsider. He's the lawyer of Glory Maitland.

name: Pauline Marionnet
description: Pauline Marionnet is a fictional character in the french book "Le parfum du bonheur est plus fort sous la pluie" having difficulties with her life. She went back to live with her parents with her child after some events with her husband.

name: Achilles (Achille)
description: In Greek mythology, Achilles or Achilleus was a hero of the Trojan War, the greatest of all the Greek warriors, and is the central character of Homer's Iliad. He was the son of the Nereid Thetis and Peleus, king of Phthia.

name: Tony Robbins
description: Anthony Jay Robbins is an American author, life coach, and philanthropist. Robbins is known for his infomercials, seminars, and self-help books including the books Unlimited Power and Awaken the Giant Within. In 2015 and 2016 Robbins was listed on the Worth Magazine Power 100 list.

name: Helen Keller
description: Helen Adams Keller was an American author, political activist, and lecturer. She was the first deaf-blind person to earn a Bachelor of Arts degree.

name: Carl Gustav Jung
description: Carl Gustav Jung, originally Karl Gustav Jung, was a Swiss psychiatrist and psychoanalyst who founded analytical psychology. Jung's work has been influential in the fields of psychiatry, anthropology, archaeology, literature, philosophy, and religious studies.

name: Wayne Gretzky
description: Wayne Douglas Gretzky CC is a Canadian former professional ice hockey player and former head coach. He played 20 seasons in the National Hockey League for four teams from 1979 to 1999.

name: Lucy
description: Lucy is a fictional character played by Jessie Buckley in the film "i'm thinking of ending things". She's new Jake's girlfriend and takes a trip with him to meet his parents.

name: Madelaine de Montargis
description: Madelaine de Montargis is a fictional character in the TV series "La Révolution" and played by Amélia Lacquemant. She's Elise's little sister and has the particularity to be muted. She often has nightmares.

name: Lucie (makesens)
description: Lucie animates the french podcast Paumé_e_s.

name: Josh Wheeler
description: Josh Wheeler is a fictional character in Daybreak TV series, where he's a lone survivor seeking his girlfriend in the post-apocalyptic landscape.

name: Joey Schweitzer
description: Joey Schweitzer is a YouTube creator. He talks about life improvement, work optimisation and social among other topics.

name: Britney Spears
description: Britney Jean Spears is an American singer, songwriter, dancer, and actress. She is credited with influencing the revival of teen pop during the late 1990s and early 2000s, for which she is referred to as the "Princess of Pop".

name: Confucius
description: Confucius was a Chinese philosopher and politician of the Spring and Autumn period. The philosophy of Confucius, also known as Confucianism, emphasized personal and governmental morality, correctness of social relationships, justice, kindness, and sincerity.
